intro: Micromeria biflora var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a desirable species for xeriscaping. The varietal name "hirsuta" refers to its hairy or pubescent appearance, distinguishing it from other varieties of Micromeria.
